intro: Dendrocolla cerina, commonly known as the hairy tree-fern, is a unique plant belonging to the family Cyatheaceae. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk covered in dense, hairy tissue that gives it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces large, feather-like fronds that can grow up to several meters in length. Dendrocolla cerina thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. Its slow growth rate and unique morphology make it a subject of interest in botanical studies.
